The two-minute 50-second video was published here on Facebook on August 13, 2020.

The post’s caption reads: “Jacinda Kate Laurell Ardern is a New Zealand politician who has served as the 40th prime minister of New Zealand. Please listen to her for what she is telling about Bhagwan Shri Krishna and Bhagavad Gita. Jay Shri Krishna.”
Krishna is a Hindu deity and Bhagavad Gita is one of the most important Hindu scriptures.
The video was also shared alongside a similar claim on Facebook here, here and here and on Twitter here and here.
The woman in the video is US congresswoman Tulsi Gabbard, a representative from the US state of Hawaii. She is the first practising Hindu member of the US Congress.
Gabbard posted the video on her official YouTube channel here on August 10, 2020. The post’s title reads: “Tulsi’s 2020 Janmashtami message.”
Janmashtami is a Hindu festival celebrating the birth of Krishna.
The same video was also published on Gabbard’s official Facebook, Twitter and Instagram accounts.
